                STATE OF NEW YORK
        ________________________________________________________________________
 
            S. 8653--A                                            A. 9310--A
 
                SENATE - ASSEMBLY
 
                                    February 26, 2024
                                       ___________
 
        IN  SENATE  --  Introduced  by  Sen.  GIANARIS -- read twice and ordered
          printed, and when printed to be committed to the Committee on Rules --
          committee discharged, bill amended, ordered reprinted as  amended  and
          recommitted to said committee
 
        IN  ASSEMBLY  --  Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  ZEBROWSKI -- read once and
          referred to the Committee  on  Governmental  Operations  --  committee
          discharged, bill amended, ordered reprinted as amended and recommitted
          to said committee
 
        AN ACT to amend the state law, in relation to establishing congressional
          districts; and to repeal article 7 of such law relating thereto
 
          The  People of the State of New York, represented in Senate and Assem-
        bly, do enact as follows:
 
     1    Section 1. Article 7 of the state law is REPEALED and a new article  7
     2  is added to read as follows:
     3                                  ARTICLE 7
     4                           CONGRESSIONAL DISTRICTS
 
     5  Section 110. Present congressional districts.
     6          111. New congressional districts.
     7          112. Separability of congressional districts.
     8    ยง 110. Present congressional districts. The congressional districts of
     9  this  state,  as  existing immediately before the effective date of this
    10  article, shall continue to be the congressional districts of  the  state
    11  until  the  expiration  of  the terms of the representatives in congress
    12  then in office, except for the purpose of an election of representatives
    13  in congress for full terms beginning at such expirations.
    14    ยง  111.  New  congressional  districts.  Notwithstanding   any   other
    15  provision  of  law  to the contrary, the congressional districts of this
    16  state from and after the effective date of this article,  shall  consist
    17  as follows:
    18    1. Congressional District 1.
    19    Within Suffolk County
    20    All of East Hampton town
 
         EXPLANATION--Matter in italics (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                              [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                   LBD14543-04-4

    48    All of Hornby town
    49    All of Hornell city
    50    All of Hornellsville town
    51    All of Howard town
    52    All of Jasper town
    53    All of Lindley town
    54    All of Rathbone town
    55    All of Thurston town
    56    All of Troupsburg town

        S. 8653--A                         23                         A. 9310--A

     1    All of Tuscarora town
     2    All of Urbana town
     3    All of Wayne town
     4    All of West Union town
     5    All of Woodhull town
     6    24. Congressional District 24.
     7    All of Genesee County
     8    All of Livingston County
     9    All of Orleans County
    10    All of Oswego County
    11    All of Seneca County
    12    All of Wayne County
    13    All of Wyoming County
    14    All of Yates County
    15    Within Cayuga County
    16    All of Lake Ontario
    17    All of Aurelius town
    18    All of Brutus town
    19    All of Cato town

    22    All of Mentz town

    12    Within Ontario County

        S. 8653--A                         25                         A. 9310--A
 
     1    All of Tonawanda city
     2    All of Tonawanda town
     3    All of West Seneca town
     4    Within Niagara County
     5    All of Niagara town
     6    All of Niagara Falls city
     7    All of North Tonawanda city
     8    Within Wheatfield town:
     9    Tracts:  022713 022714 022715 022901
    10    Tract: 022716 Blocks: 1002 1004-1022 2000-2022
    11    Tract: 022717 Blocks: 1000-1008 2000-2016 3000-3015
    12    ยง  112.  Separability  of  congressional districts. Each congressional
    13  district created by this article shall be deemed a separate district for
    14  the purpose of apportionment of  the  entire  state  into  congressional
    15  districts.  If one or more congressional districts created by this arti-
    16  cle are judicially found not to be in compliance with the decisions  and
    17  mandates  of  a  court  of  competent  jurisdiction,  only the defective
    18  district or districts and those immediately adjacent or contiguous ther-
    19  eto shall be reapportioned. All other districts shall be  deemed  to  be
    20  properly created.
    21    ยง  2. Construction. a. This act shall be liberally construed to effec-
    22  tuate the purposes thereof and to apportion and district this  state  in
    23  compliance  with  constitutional  and  statutory  requirements and shall
    24  supersede any inconsistent provision of law including but not limited to
    25  section 3 of chapter 17 of the laws of 2012.
    26    b. It is intended  that  this  act  and  the  congressional  districts
    27  described  herein  completely encompass all the area of the state. It is
    28  also intended that such districts apportioned on the basis of 2020 popu-
    29  lation, contain the whole number of persons in this state. It is further
    30  intended that the apportionment and districting provided for in this act
    31  result in the creation of districts containing equal population as near-
    32  ly as practicable. It is also intended that no  district  shall  include
    33  any of the area included within the description of any other district.
    34    ยง  3.  Saving  clause. a. If the districts described in the act do not
    35  carry out the purposes  thereof,  because  of  unintentional  omissions;
    36  duplications;   overlapping   areas;  erroneous  nomenclature;  lack  of
    37  adequate maps or descriptions of political subdivisions, wards, or other
    38  divisions thereof, or of their boundary lines; street closings,  changes
    39  in  names  of  streets, or other changes of public places; alteration of
    40  the boundary or courses of waters or  waterways,  filling  in  of  lands
    41  underwater,  accretion  or  other changes in shorelines or alteration of
    42  courses, rights of way, or lines of public  utilities  or  other  condi-
    43  tions,  then  the state board of elections, at the request of any person
    44  or candidate, aggrieved thereby, shall, by  order,  correct  such  omis-
    45  sions,  overlappings,  erroneous  nomenclature,  or other defects in the
    46  description of districts so as to accomplish the purposes and objectives
    47  of this act.
    48    b. In promulgating such orders, the state board of elections, in addi-
    49  tion to achieving equality in the population of districts  and  ensuring
    50  that all areas of the state are completely and accurately encompassed in
    51  such districts, shall be guided by the following standards:
    52    (1)  Gaps  in  the description of any district shall be completed in a
    53  manner which results in a total description of that  district  consonant
    54  with  the  description  of  adjacent  districts  and results in complete
    55  contiguity of districts.

        S. 8653--A                         26                         A. 9310--A
 
     1    (2) Areas of the state included within the descriptions of  more  than
     2  one  district shall be allocated to the district having the lowest popu-
     3  lation.
     4    (3)  Areas  of  the  state not included within the descriptions of any
     5  district shall be allocated to the adjacent district having  the  lowest
     6  population.
     7    (4)  In  the  event  that the area subject to corrected description or
     8  allocation as provided in paragraphs one, two or three of this  subdivi-
     9  sion,  is of such size or contains such population that its inclusion as
    10  a unit in any district would result  in  substantial  disparity  in  the
    11  size,  shape  or  population  of  such district, then the state board of
    12  elections may allocate portions of such area to two or more districts.
    13    (5) In any allocation of area or  correction  of  a  description  made
    14  pursuant to this section, the state board of elections shall, consistent
    15  with the foregoing standards, preserve the contiguity and compactness of
    16  districts and avoid the unnecessary division of political subdivisions.
    17    c.  Copies  of  such  orders  shall  be  filed  by  the state board of
    18  elections in its own office and in the office of the affected boards  of
    19  election.  A  copy  of  each such order shall also be filed by the state
    20  board with the legislative bill drafting commission to facilitate it  in
    21  performing  its functions under section 70-b of the public officers law.
    22  In addition, a copy of such order shall be served  upon  the  person  or
    23  candidate, if any, who instituted the application for such an order. The
    24  state  board  of  elections  may  adopt  reasonable rules regulating the
    25  procedure for applications for orders under this section in  the  manner
    26  of serving and filing any notice or copy of orders relating thereto.
    27    d.  Upon  the filing of such an order, the description of any affected
    28  district shall be deemed to have been corrected in the  manner  provided
    29  in  such  order  to  the  full  extent  as  if  such correction had been
    30  contained in the original description set forth in this act.
    31    e. In furtherance of effectuating the provisions of subdivision  d  of
    32  this  section,  the  legislative  bill drafting commission, upon receipt
    33  from the state board of elections of an order  promulgated  pursuant  to
    34  subdivision  b  of  this section, and upon the approval of the temporary
    35  president of the senate and the speaker of the assembly, shall cause the
    36  description of a congressional district altered  pursuant  to  any  such
    37  order  to be revised accordingly within its data base of the laws of the
    38  state of New York so that such altered district may be  contained  in  a
    39  publication of the state law and be certified to as a correct transcript
    40  of  the text of law relating thereto such district in the manner author-
    41  ized by section 70-b of the public officers law.
    42    f. If any part or provision of this act relating to any  congressional
    43  district shall be adjudged invalid by a court of competent jurisdiction,
    44  such  judgment  shall:  (1)  be confined in its operation to the part or
    45  provision of this act or the  district  or  districts  described  herein
    46  directly  involved  in the controversy in which such judgment shall have
    47  been rendered, and (2) not affect or impair the validity of the  remain-
    48  ing parts, provisions or districts described in this act or elsewhere.
    49    g.  The congressional districts of this state, as existing immediately
    50  prior to the effective date of  this  act,  shall  continue  to  be  the
    51  congressional  districts  of the state for the purpose of filling vacan-
    52  cies in the office of representative in congress at any special election
    53  held prior to the general election of the year 2024.
    54    h. The congressional districts of  this  state,  from  and  after  the
    55  effective  date of this act, shall be the congressional districts of the
    56  state for the purpose  of  designating  and  nominating  candidates  for

        S. 8653--A                         27                         A. 9310--A
 
     1  representatives  in  congress,  and  for electing district delegates and
     2  alternate district delegates to national party conventions.
     3    i.  In  order  to  provide  for  an orderly election of members of the
     4  congress from the state of New York and in recognition of the  constitu-
     5  tional  mandate  that  congressional  districts  shall be created by law
     6  subject to judicial review under  such  reasonable  regulations  as  the
     7  legislature  may prescribe, it is hereby determined and declared that no
     8  order of the court invalidating  this  act  or  part  thereof  shall  be
     9  entered in a manner which will deprive the legislature of an opportunity
    10  to  discharge its constitutional mandate. In any proceeding for judicial
    11  review of the provisions of this act, the  determination  of  the  court
    12  shall  be embodied in a tentative order which shall become final 30 days
    13  after service of copies thereof upon the parties unless the court shall,
    14  in the interval, on application of any party, resettle its order.
    15    j. If any clause, sentence, paragraph, section or  part  of  this  act
    16  shall  be adjudged by any court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid,
    17  such judgment shall not affect, impair or invalidate the remainder ther-
    18  eof, but shall be confined in its operation  to  the  clause,  sentence,
    19  paragraph,  section or part thereof directly involved in the controversy
    20  in which such judgment shall have been rendered.
    21    ยง 4. Separability. If any clause, sentence, paragraph, section or part
    22  of this act shall be adjudged by any court of competent jurisdiction  to
    23  be  invalid,  such  judgment  shall not affect, impair or invalidate the
    24  remainder thereof, but shall be confined in its operation to the clause,
    25  sentence, paragraph, section or part thereof directly  involved  in  the
    26  controversy in which such judgment shall have been rendered.
    27    ยง 5. This act shall take effect immediately.



 
                STATE OF NEW YORK
        ________________________________________________________________________
 
            S. 8653--A                                            A. 9310--A
 
                SENATE - ASSEMBLY
 
                                    February 26, 2024
                                       ___________
 
        IN  SENATE  --  Introduced  by  Sen.  GIANARIS -- read twice and ordered
          printed, and when printed to be committed to the Committee on Rules --
          committee discharged, bill amended, ordered reprinted as  amended  and
          recommitted to said committee
 
        IN  ASSEMBLY  --  Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  ZEBROWSKI -- read once and
          referred to the Committee  on  Governmental  Operations  --  committee
          discharged, bill amended, ordered reprinted as amended and recommitted
          to said committee
 
        AN ACT to amend the state law, in relation to establishing congressional
          districts; and to repeal article 7 of such law relating thereto
 
          The  People of the State of New York, represented in Senate and Assem-
        bly, do enact as follows:
 
     1    Section 1. Article 7 of the state law is REPEALED and a new article  7
     2  is added to read as follows:
     3                                  ARTICLE 7
     4                           CONGRESSIONAL DISTRICTS
 
     5  Section 110. Present congressional districts.
     6          111. New congressional districts.
     7          112. Separability of congressional districts.
     8    ยง 110. Present congressional districts. The congressional districts of
     9  this  state,  as  existing immediately before the effective date of this
    10  article, shall continue to be the congressional districts of  the  state
    11  until  the  expiration  of  the terms of the representatives in congress
    12  then in office, except for the purpose of an election of representatives
    13  in congress for full terms beginning at such expirations.
    14    ยง  111.  New  congressional  districts.  Notwithstanding   any   other
    15  provision  of  law  to the contrary, the congressional districts of this
    16  state from and after the effective date of this article,  shall  consist
    17  as follows:
    18    1. Congressional District 1.
    19    Within Suffolk County
    20    All of East Hampton town
 
         EXPLANATION--Matter in italics (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                              [ ] is old law to be omitted.

     1    Tract: 111201 Blocks: 1000-1013

    28    5. Congressional District 5.

    30    Within Queens Borough:
    31    Tracts:    002400  002600  002800  003200  004001 004002 006201 008600
    32  008800 009400 009600 009800 010000 010200 010400  010600  010800  011000
    33  011200  011400  011600  011800 012000 012200 012400 012601 012602 012800
    34  013000 013200 013400 013600 013800 014000 014201  014202  014400  014800
    35  015000  015200  015400  015600 015801 015802 016400 016600 016800 017000

        S. 8653--A                         25                         A. 9310--A
 
     1    All of Tonawanda city
     2    All of Tonawanda town
     3    All of West Seneca town
     4    Within Niagara County
     5    All of Niagara town
     6    All of Niagara Falls city
     7    All of North Tonawanda city
     8    Within Wheatfield town:
     9    Tracts:  022713 022714 022715 022901
    10    Tract: 022716 Blocks: 1002 1004-1022 2000-2022
    11    Tract: 022717 Blocks: 1000-1008 2000-2016 3000-3015
    12    ยง  112.  Separability  of  congressional districts. Each congressional
    13  district created by this article shall be deemed a separate district for
    14  the purpose of apportionment of  the  entire  state  into  congressional
    15  districts.  If one or more congressional districts created by this arti-
    16  cle are judicially found not to be in compliance with the decisions  and
    17  mandates  of  a  court  of  competent  jurisdiction,  only the defective
    18  district or districts and those immediately adjacent or contiguous ther-
    19  eto shall be reapportioned. All other districts shall be  deemed  to  be
    20  properly created.
    21    ยง  2. Construction. a. This act shall be liberally construed to effec-
    22  tuate the purposes thereof and to apportion and district this  state  in
    23  compliance  with  constitutional  and  statutory  requirements and shall
    24  supersede any inconsistent provision of law including but not limited to
    25  section 3 of chapter 17 of the laws of 2012.
    26    b. It is intended  that  this  act  and  the  congressional  districts
    27  described  herein  completely encompass all the area of the state. It is
    28  also intended that such districts apportioned on the basis of 2020 popu-
    29  lation, contain the whole number of persons in this state. It is further
    30  intended that the apportionment and districting provided for in this act
    31  result in the creation of districts containing equal population as near-
    32  ly as practicable. It is also intended that no  district  shall  include
    33  any of the area included within the description of any other district.
    34    ยง  3.  Saving  clause. a. If the districts described in the act do not
    35  carry out the purposes  thereof,  because  of  unintentional  omissions;
    36  duplications;   overlapping   areas;  erroneous  nomenclature;  lack  of
    37  adequate maps or descriptions of political subdivisions, wards, or other
    38  divisions thereof, or of their boundary lines; street closings,  changes
    39  in  names  of  streets, or other changes of public places; alteration of
    40  the boundary or courses of waters or  waterways,  filling  in  of  lands
    41  underwater,  accretion  or  other changes in shorelines or alteration of
    42  courses, rights of way, or lines of public  utilities  or  other  condi-
    43  tions,  then  the state board of elections, at the request of any person
    44  or candidate, aggrieved thereby, shall, by  order,  correct  such  omis-
    45  sions,  overlappings,  erroneous  nomenclature,  or other defects in the
    46  description of districts so as to accomplish the purposes and objectives
    47  of this act.
    48    b. In promulgating such orders, the state board of elections, in addi-
    49  tion to achieving equality in the population of districts  and  ensuring
    50  that all areas of the state are completely and accurately encompassed in
    51  such districts, shall be guided by the following standards:
    52    (1)  Gaps  in  the description of any district shall be completed in a
    53  manner which results in a total description of that  district  consonant
    54  with  the  description  of  adjacent  districts  and results in complete
    55  contiguity of districts.


        S. 8653--A                         26                         A. 9310--A
 
     1    (2) Areas of the state included within the descriptions of  more  than
     2  one  district shall be allocated to the district having the lowest popu-
     3  lation.
     4    (3)  Areas  of  the  state not included within the descriptions of any
     5  district shall be allocated to the adjacent district having  the  lowest
     6  population.
     7    (4)  In  the  event  that the area subject to corrected description or
     8  allocation as provided in paragraphs one, two or three of this  subdivi-
     9  sion,  is of such size or contains such population that its inclusion as
    10  a unit in any district would result  in  substantial  disparity  in  the
    11  size,  shape  or  population  of  such district, then the state board of
    12  elections may allocate portions of such area to two or more districts.
    13    (5) In any allocation of area or  correction  of  a  description  made
    14  pursuant to this section, the state board of elections shall, consistent
    15  with the foregoing standards, preserve the contiguity and compactness of
    16  districts and avoid the unnecessary division of political subdivisions.
    17    c.  Copies  of  such  orders  shall  be  filed  by  the state board of
    18  elections in its own office and in the office of the affected boards  of
    19  election.  A  copy  of  each such order shall also be filed by the state
    20  board with the legislative bill drafting commission to facilitate it  in
    21  performing  its functions under section 70-b of the public officers law.
    22  In addition, a copy of such order shall be served  upon  the  person  or
    23  candidate, if any, who instituted the application for such an order. The
    24  state  board  of  elections  may  adopt  reasonable rules regulating the
    25  procedure for applications for orders under this section in  the  manner
    26  of serving and filing any notice or copy of orders relating thereto.
    27    d.  Upon  the filing of such an order, the description of any affected
    28  district shall be deemed to have been corrected in the  manner  provided
    29  in  such  order  to  the  full  extent  as  if  such correction had been
    30  contained in the original description set forth in this act.
    31    e. In furtherance of effectuating the provisions of subdivision  d  of
    32  this  section,  the  legislative  bill drafting commission, upon receipt
    33  from the state board of elections of an order  promulgated  pursuant  to
    34  subdivision  b  of  this section, and upon the approval of the temporary
    35  president of the senate and the speaker of the assembly, shall cause the
    36  description of a congressional district altered  pursuant  to  any  such
    37  order  to be revised accordingly within its data base of the laws of the
    38  state of New York so that such altered district may be  contained  in  a
    39  publication of the state law and be certified to as a correct transcript
    40  of  the text of law relating thereto such district in the manner author-
    41  ized by section 70-b of the public officers law.
    42    f. If any part or provision of this act relating to any  congressional
    43  district shall be adjudged invalid by a court of competent jurisdiction,
    44  such  judgment  shall:  (1)  be confined in its operation to the part or
    45  provision of this act or the  district  or  districts  described  herein
    46  directly  involved  in the controversy in which such judgment shall have
    47  been rendered, and (2) not affect or impair the validity of the  remain-
    48  ing parts, provisions or districts described in this act or elsewhere.
    49    g.  The congressional districts of this state, as existing immediately
    50  prior to the effective date of  this  act,  shall  continue  to  be  the
    51  congressional  districts  of the state for the purpose of filling vacan-
    52  cies in the office of representative in congress at any special election
    53  held prior to the general election of the year 2024.
    54    h. The congressional districts of  this  state,  from  and  after  the
    55  effective  date of this act, shall be the congressional districts of the
    56  state for the purpose  of  designating  and  nominating  candidates  for


        S. 8653--A                         27                         A. 9310--A
 
     1  representatives  in  congress,  and  for electing district delegates and
     2  alternate district delegates to national party conventions.
     3    i.  In  order  to  provide  for  an orderly election of members of the
     4  congress from the state of New York and in recognition of the  constitu-
     5  tional  mandate  that  congressional  districts  shall be created by law
     6  subject to judicial review under  such  reasonable  regulations  as  the
     7  legislature  may prescribe, it is hereby determined and declared that no
     8  order of the court invalidating  this  act  or  part  thereof  shall  be
     9  entered in a manner which will deprive the legislature of an opportunity
    10  to  discharge its constitutional mandate. In any proceeding for judicial
    11  review of the provisions of this act, the  determination  of  the  court
    12  shall  be embodied in a tentative order which shall become final 30 days
    13  after service of copies thereof upon the parties unless the court shall,
    14  in the interval, on application of any party, resettle its order.
    15    j. If any clause, sentence, paragraph, section or  part  of  this  act
    16  shall  be adjudged by any court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid,
    17  such judgment shall not affect, impair or invalidate the remainder ther-
    18  eof, but shall be confined in its operation  to  the  clause,  sentence,
    19  paragraph,  section or part thereof directly involved in the controversy
    20  in which such judgment shall have been rendered.
    21    ยง 4. Separability. If any clause, sentence, paragraph, section or part
    22  of this act shall be adjudged by any court of competent jurisdiction  to
    23  be  invalid,  such  judgment  shall not affect, impair or invalidate the
    24  remainder thereof, but shall be confined in its operation to the clause,
    25  sentence, paragraph, section or part thereof directly  involved  in  the
    26  controversy in which such judgment shall have been rendered.
    27    ยง 5. This act shall take effect immediately.
